page.title: 04Attitudes Newton/Dunham area
page.content: Attitudes vary with a persons age.People of middle age and over have usually lived in the area all their lives and have relatives and friends in the area. They do not leave the village much and regret the lack of public transport and central points of old village life - doctor butcher baker. They feel life is not as good as it was. New people to the area have usually chosen to live here and purchased houses. They tend to be young, most have children and have created facilities for them such as playgroups toddlers clubs and youth clubs. Children attend the village schools happily and play outdoors after school when the weather permits. They are more unsophisticated than children from the towns.
